content.description: The map below shows energy-dependent and energy-independent countries around the world.
content.question: Which of the following statements about the global distribution and use of fossil fuels is best supported by the data on the map?

choices.label: Saudi Arabia and Australia produce large volumes of fossil fuels with relatively low energy demand.
The United States produces more fossil fuels than it consumes.
Japan has the greatest energy independence because there are abundant reserves of fossil fuels present in the country.
Russia and Indonesia are reliant on the export of other nations for their fossil fuels.

content.answer: Saudi Arabia and Australia produce large volumes of fossil fuels with relatively low energy demand.
